title: Former Walkers factory site bought by Heather Mills to bring jobs back
text:

A former snack food factory in the North East closed by Leicester snack firm Walkers leading to the loss of 355 jobs has been bought by Heather Mills.
The vegan food firm owned by Heather Mills has taken on the former snack factory in Peterlee, near Sunderland, in a bid to bring employment back to the site which shut down last year.
Revealing the purchase, Ms Mills spoke out about protecting British manufacturing in the wake of Brexit, reports Chronicle Live .
Around 355 redundancies were made last year when PepsiCo, which owns Walkers, revealed it was closing the factory to make “significant productivity and efficiency savings” within the business. Read More
But jobs could be about to return to the site after Ms Mills revealed she bought the site after hearing that a friend who had worked at workers had lost their job. Heather Mills
It is thought that the factory has been acquired through Ms Mills’ vegan food company VBites. The company sells a range of plant-based meals designed to replace meat, fish, and dairy products.
Speaking on ITV’s This Morning, Ms Mills said: “I am pleading with the supermarkets to buy British. Read More
"We have Brexit on the way, we are in this situation love it or hate it.
"The manufactures are leaving for Germany left, right and centre. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
